definition: in confusion or disorder/in a confused state of mind/disorder/upheaval/riot/illicit sexual relations/to throw into disorder/to mix up/indiscriminate/random/arbitrary

sentences.english: Those boys have scribbled on the fence.
sentences.chinese: 那些男孩在栅栏上乱写乱涂。

sentences.english: As to writing, we do not encourage them to scrawl too early .
sentences.chinese: 至于书法，我们不鼓励他们过早地乱写。

sentences.english: He too would roll up his sleeves and scribble for money.
sentences.chinese: 他也卷起袖子，为钱乱写一通。
在墙上乱写乱画是不对的。

sentences.english: I have tons of journals filled with nothing but scribble.
sentences.chinese: 我有很多日记本什么都没写，除了乱写乱画。

sentences.english: Remember when your teacher told you to stop doodling in class?
sentences.chinese: 可曾记得你的老师叫你不要再在课堂上乱写乱画？

sentences.english: Stop vandalism. Don't scribble on walls.
sentences.chinese: 严禁破坏公物，禁止在墙上乱写乱画。

sentences.english: It took three applications of paint to cover the graffiti.
sentences.chinese: 刷了三道油漆才盖住了乱涂乱写的东西。

sentences.english: I know now, I should not write what.
sentences.chinese: 我知道此时此刻，我不该再乱写什么。

sentences.english: In this scribble scrawl, children start their initial graffiti experiment.
sentences.chinese: 在这种乱画乱写中，孩子开始了他们最初的涂鸦实验。

definition: to make things up/to concoct (a story, an excuse etc)
to concoct a cock-and-bull story (idiom)/to make things up
to invent crazy nonsense/to cook up (excuses)/to talk at random/wild babble
lit. chasing the wind and clutching at shadows (idiom); fig. groundless accusations/to act on hearsay evidence
to make a wild guess/blind guess
to write without lifting one's pen from the paper/(in the Romanization of Chinese) to write two or more syllables together as a single word (not separated by spaces)
lit. to put Zhang's hat on Li's head/to attribute sth to the wrong person (idiom)/to confuse one thing with another
